Container.Name: FileFlow
Container.Overview:
FileFlow is a app that lets you process files in a rule flow like system.
You can setup rules like when a video file is detected, detect if it has black bars, reencode video to certain format, move file, delete original. Or if file is greater than this size delete etc.
Advanced settings Nvidia GPU Use: 1) Install the Unraid Nvidia Driver Plugin. 2) Toggle this Docker Container template editor to "Advanced View". 3) In the "Extra Parameters" field, add "--runtime=nvidia". 4) Expand the template "Show more settings..." section. 5) In the "NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES" variable, copy your GPU UUID (can be found in the Unraid Nvidia Plugin)

Config.Name: WebUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the WebUI. The container uses port 5000 this can forward any port to that in the container.

Config.Name: Data
Config.Description: Location of the database file, best to set this in appdata

Config.Name: Logs
Config.Description: logging directory, best to store this with the appdata

Config.Name: Temp Directory
Config.Description: Where temporary files will be created during the file flow process Best to put this on a cache drive or a faster ssd/nvme

Config.Name: /media/
Config.Description: Mapping to a folder in unRAID. this is optional and you can add as many as you like.
